articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Like you (if you are typical of the CQN demographic) and me, Kasper Schmeichel is older than Joe Hart.  In itself, this doesn’t mean he is wrong for Celtic, he could be a perfect fit for what we require. I suspect, however, we will both be alarmed that our recruitment strategy has pivoted so sharply [...]
articles.title: Kasper spooks

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has revealed Alistair Johnston will be given an extended break before the Premiership kicks off. Celtic are scheduled to take on Kilmarnock at Parkhead on Sunday August 4 as they begin the defence of the title they have won for the past three years. The champions’ squad are preparing to fly out to [...]
articles.title: REVEALED: EXTENDED BREAK FOR HOOPS DEFENDER

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: OH HYEON-GYU is heading for the Celtic exit with reports from Belgium insisting it’s only a “matter of time” before he seals a move to Genk. The South Korean international striker is seen as surplus to requirements by Brendan Rodgers and his time at the champions is coming to a halt, as CQN stated in May. Oh cost [...]
articles.title: ‘MATTER OF TIME,’ £4m CELT ON BRINK OF EXIT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TOMMY BURNS travelled to Ibrox on the Sunday afternoon of November 27 1994 with the opportunity of winning the League Cup – just four months after his return to Celtic as manager. Raith Rovers, from the First Division, stood in the way of the club’s iconic midfielder and fans’ favourite lifting his first piece of [...]
articles.title: THE TOMMY BURNS STORY: THE DESPERATE HOURS: Part Two

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC are on the brink of sealing a one-year deal with legendary Danish keeper Kasper Schmeichel. Brendan Rodgers views his former Leicester City No.1 as the ideal replacement for the retiring Joe Hart. Schmeichel, who will be 38 in November, is a free agent after leaving Belgian outfit Anderlecht in the summer. The towering shotstopper [...]
articles.title: SCHMEICHEL GREEN LIGHT: ANOTHER ON WAY?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: OLIVIER KAPO had enjoyed a colourful career – including a period with Italian giants Juventus – by the time he turned up at Celtic. The attacking midfielder spent a mere three months at Parkhead after arriving on a short-term contract following his release by Wigan in early November 2010. The Ivory Coast-born French international, at the [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…OLIVIER KAPO?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC boss Brendan Rodgers is hoping to add to his squad that will fly to the USA a week tomorrow. The Hoops gaffer is gearing up for three pre-season games against DC United, Manchester City and Chelsea before the Premiership kicks off against Kilmarnock at Parkhead on Flag Day three weeks on Sunday. The champions [...]
articles.title: ‘NEED TO IMPROVE,’ RODGERS’ SIGNINGS TIMELINE

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: How much success is inbuilt talent, how much is application and how much is development at key times? The latter is crucial. International youth teams are filled with teens who make no impact on the game, as the inbuilt that earned them a youth cap withers, while others grow through their early adult years. It’s [...]
articles.title: The 18-year-olds you have

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CONTRACT rebel Daniel Kelly has been dumped by Brendan Rodgers from his pre-season plans. The 18-year-old midfielder rejected the offer of a new deal from the champions and can walk away when his terms expire at the turn of the year. Kelly was handed his debut by Rodgers in the 5-0 Scottish Cup win over Buckie Thistle [...]
articles.title: CELTIC CONTRACT REBEL DUMPED

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: A TRIO of Celtic stars are in demand as Brendan Rodgers attempts to strengthen his squad before the Premiership kicks off in just 24 days’ time. Matt O’Riley, Reo Hatate and Oh Hyeon-gyu are on the wanted list of clubs in Italy, Russia and England. The champions have acted swiftly to boot out bids for [...]
articles.title: CELTIC TRIO IN DEMAND

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TOMMY BURNS returned to his beloved Celtic as manager EXACTLY 30 years ago today. It was an emotional and controversial homecoming for the Hoops legend as he left Kilmarnock in acrimonious circumstances to take over from the sacked Lou Macari. Celtic were accused of ‘tapping’ the boss while he was in charge at the Ayrshire club [...]
articles.title: THE TOMMY BURNS STORY: WELCOME BACK TO CELTIC: Part One

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: RAMI GERSHON’S scoring ratio for a full-back at Celtic was even more prolific than that of Lisbon Lion Tommy Gemmell, the swashbuckling hero of Jock Stein’s all-conquering team. The 25-year-old Israeli left-sided defender fired in a goal every three games. Unfortunately, Gershon only made three first-team appearances for the Hoops after joining on loan from Standard [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…RAMI GERSHON?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The main ingredients of a viable football club are a significant fan base, an appropriate stadium and TV deal. Celtic over achieve with the fan base, which offsets a deficient TV deal. Without a large stadium, Celtic would survive in some form, but it wouldn’t be the club we know and love.  We should always [...]
articles.title: Ingredients of a viable football club

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ODIN HOLM politely declined to wave the Premiership silverware at the celebrating Celtic fans following the 3-2 win over St Mirren on the final day of the league season at Parkhead on May 18. It was clear the Norwegian midfielder, who arrived in a £2.25million switch from Valerenga the previous summer, did not reckon he [...]
articles.title: IDEAL, HOLM?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ‘VERY BRIGHT,’ BOSS PRAISE FOR KYOGO KYOGO FURUHASHI managed something against Queen’s Park that eluded him throughout last season – score three goals in one game. The Japanese striker failed to claim a hat-trick last time out as he struggled for consistency and had to be content with a goal haul of 19, his lowest [...]
articles.title: ‘VERY BRIGHT,’ BOSS PRAISE FOR KYOGO

articles.description: CELTIC’S talent-spotters were suitably impressed by Mo Bangura’s strike rate at AIK Stockholm to draw him to the attention of manager Neil Lennon. articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…MO BANGURA?

articles.description: Last week we discussed the stalled career of Liam Morrison, who left Celtic as a teenager five years ago to go to Bayern Munich but having made no impact there has now grabbed a lifeline at QPR. This should give Daniel Kelly (18) something to ponder as he stalls on accepting a contract offer from [...]
articles.title: Be more like Matt and less like Liam.

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC are still attempting to push ahead with a new deal for Daniel Kelly whose current contract expires on the last day of 2024. articles.description: IT APPEARED £3million new Bhoy Nicolas Kuhn had hit the ground running when he scored within six minutes of his second Celtic appearance. articles.description: NEIL LENNON reckoned he had pulled off a signing coup when he brought Venezuelan striker Miku to Celtic on loan on the last day of the transfer window on August 31 2012. articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…MIKU?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: I expect you and I will discuss Celtic Park in the week after last season’s financial report is published.  We have plenty of work to do and, I expect, will have a new record back balance. So we’ll be light on self-satisfaction, but still…… I’ve kept away from the Ibrox debacle thus far. Despite that [...]

Bolingoli, who completed his ill-fated £3million transfer to [...]

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
Celtic FC Foundation are delighted to announce that Brendan Rodgers and members of the first-team squad will be joined at our charity dinner at Notre Dame Stadium on Friday, July 26 by Celtic legends, Roy Aitken and Stiliyan Petrov. The Bear started a 15-year career at Celtic as a 16-year-old in 1975 and first captained […]
The post Celtic FC Foundation to host Charity Dinner at Notre Dame Stadium appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: Celtic FC Foundation to host Charity Dinner at Notre Dame Stadium
